info.title: Voucherify API - Referrals
info.description: Voucherify promotion engine REST API. Please see https://docs.voucherify.io/docs for more details. - Endpoints tagged with 'Referrals'

post.description:
Adds new holders to a referral code as **referees**. The data sent in the request is upserted into the customer data.

If the request returns an error even for one customer, you have to resend the whole request. Customer data is upserted if the data for all customers is correct.

To use this endpoint, you must have the following permissions:
- Create and modify Customers and Segments (`customers.modify`)
- Publish Voucher (`vouchers.publish`)

> ðŸ‘
>To add a holder as a referer, use the [Create Publication](ref:create-publication) endpoint.

requestBody.description: Specify the customer data to be upserted as redeemable holders.

200.description: Returns a list of redeemable holder objects.

400.description: Returns an error if the payload is incorrect or the referral card has not been published yet.

value.details: Property .holders must NOT have fewer than 1 items
Referral code must be first published to Referrer before assigning it to Referee

403.description: Returns an error if the user is missing permissions.

value.details: User does not have a required permission to perform this operation.

404.description: Returns an error indicating that the referral code with a given ID or the campaign with a given ID was not found.

value.details: Cannot find voucher with id REFAPI-mk
Cannot find campaign with id camp_v1mxc6sGDlXzQygz8wBc8HVU

409.description: Returns an error if a voucher code already exists, the customer has been already assigned as a referrer or referee, or the `source_id` and `id` of the same customer has been used in two different objects in the request.

value.details: Duplicated customer exists with id tst-prsn10

value.message: Customer is already assigned to given redeemable

get.description:
Retrieves all the redeemables that have been assigned to the customer.

To use this endpoint, you must have the following permissions:

- Read Customers (`customers.details.read`)

parameters.name: order
parameters.description: Sorts the results using one of the filtering options, where the dash `-` preceding a sorting option means sorting in a descending order.

parameters.name: starting_after_id
parameters.description: A cursor for pagination. It retrieves the events starting after an event with the given ID.

200.description: Returns the holders of the redeemable that is assigned to the referral campaign.

404.description: Returns an error if a resource is not found.

value.details: Cannot find voucher with id v_wnd4fslUpkLnZH0KthYDxouBSgn24Yr

delete.description:
Removes the holder from a referral card. You can remove a referee only.

To use this endpoint, you must have the following permissions:
- Create and modify Customers and Segments (`customers.modify`)
- Publish Voucher (`vouchers.publish`)

204.description: Returns no content if removal is successful.

403.description: Returns an error if the user is missing permissions or is trying to remove the referrer.

value.details: User does not have a required permission to perform this operation.
You can not remove Referrer assignment

404.description: Returns an error if a resource cannot be found.

value.details: Cannot find campaign with id camp_vVk4unz3k4gA023fk9XoSiT
Cannot find redeemable_holder with id rh_0f1ab744ce8277d0dc
Cannot find voucher with id v_uOrG9tQresN9X51gbAoo0a2vY4MLV9l

post.description:
Adds new holders to a referral code as **referees**. The data sent in the request is upserted into the customer data.

If the request returns an error even for one customer, you have to resend the whole request. Customer data is upserted if the data for all customers is correct.

To use this endpoint, you must have the following permissions:
- Create and modify Customers and Segments (`customers.modify`)
- Publish Voucher (`vouchers.publish`)

> ðŸ‘
>To add a holder as a referer, use the [Create Publication](ref:create-publication) endpoint.

> ðŸ“˜ Alternative endpoint
>
>This endpoint is an alternative to the [Add Referral Code Holders endpoint](ref:referrals-add-holders-1). The URL was re-designed to retrieve the referral member holders without providing the `campaignId` as a path paremeter.

requestBody.description: Specify the customer data to be upserted as redeemable holders.

200.description: Returns a list of redeemable holder objects.

400.description: Returns an error if the payload is incorrect or the referral card has not been published yet.

value.details: Property .holders must NOT have fewer than 1 items
Referral code must be first published to Referrer before assigning it to Referee

403.description: Returns an error if the user is missing permissions.

value.details: User does not have a required permission to perform this operation.

404.description: Returns an error indicating that the referral code with a given ID was not found.

value.details: Cannot find voucher with id REFAPI-mk

409.description: Returns an error if a voucher code already exists, the customer has been already assigned as a referrer or referee, or the `source_id` and `id` of the same customer has been used in two different objects in the request.

value.details: Duplicated customer exists with id tst-prsn10

value.message: Customer is already assigned to given redeemable

get.description:
Retrieves the holders of the referral code from a referral campaign.

To use this endpoint, you must have the following permissions:

- Read Customers (`customers.details.read`)

> ðŸ“˜ Alternative endpoint
>
>This endpoint is an alternative to the [List Member Holders endpoint](ref:referrals-member-holders). The URL was re-designed to retrieve the referral member holders without providing the `campaignId` as a path paremeter.

parameters.name: order
parameters.description: Sorts the results using one of the filtering options, where the dash - preceding a sorting option means sorting in a descending order.

parameters.name: starting_after_id
parameters.description: A cursor for pagination. It retrieves the events starting after an event with the given ID.

200.description: Returns the holders of the redeemable that is assigned to the referral campaign.

404.description: Returns an error if a resource is not found.

value.details: Cannot find voucher with id v_wnd4fslUpkLnZH0KthYDxouBSgn24Yr

delete.description:
Removes the holder from a referral card. You can remove a referee only.

To use this endpoint, you must have the following permissions:
- Create and modify Customers and Segments (`customers.modify`)
- Publish Voucher (`vouchers.publish`)

> ðŸ“˜ Alternative endpoint
>
>This endpoint is an alternative to the [Remove Referral Card Holder endpoint](ref:referrals-remove-holder-1). The URL was re-designed to retrieve the referral member holders without providing the `campaignId` as a path paremeter.

204.description: Returns no content if removal is successful.

403.description: Returns an error if the user is missing permissions or is trying to remove the referrer.

value.details: User does not have a required permission to perform this operation.
You can not remove Referrer assignment

404.description: Returns an error if a resource cannot be found.

value.details: Cannot find redeemable_holder with id rh_0f1ab744ce8277d0dc
Cannot find voucher with id v_uOrG9tQresN9X51gbAoo0a2vY4MLV9l

holders.title: Holder Array
holders.description: Array of holders to be added to a referral card as referees. You have to send at least one object in the array up to a maximum of 100 objects. You can send either a `source_id` or `id`, or both; however, at least one of them is required. If both are sent, Voucherify checks `id` to upsert that customer's data.

metadata.description: A set of custom key/value pairs that you can attach to the redeemable holders sent in the array. The value can be a string, number, boolean, date, datetime, image URL, or object. The metadata must meet the metadata schema for publications. The metadata object stores all custom attributes assigned to the redeemable holder.

ReferralsMembersHoldersCreateInBulkRespo.title: Add Referral Code Holder Response Body

holders.description: Contains an array of referral card holders who are the customers sent in the request.

key.description: Short string describing the kind of error which occurred.

message.description: A human-readable message providing a short description of the error.

details.description: A human-readable message providing more details about the error.

request_id.description: This ID is useful when troubleshooting and/or finding the root cause of an error response by our support team.

resource_id.description: Unique resource ID that can be used in another endpoint to get more details.

error.description: Includes additional information about the error.

message.description: The message configured by the user in a validation rule.

created_at.description: Timestamp representing the date and time when the redeemable was added to the holder. The value is shown in the ISO 8601 format.

holder_role.description:
Holder role of the redeemable. Allowed values:
`REFEREE`,
`REFERRER`

$in.description: Array of resource values that should be included in the results (multiple values).

$not_in.description: Array of resource values that should be included in the results (multiple values).

$is.description: Value is exactly this value (single value).

$has_value.description: Value is NOT null. The value for this parameter is an empty string.

$is_unknown.description: Value is null. The value for this parameter is an empty string.

$starts_with.description: Value starts with the specified string.

$ends_with.description: Value ends with the specified string.

ReferralsMembersHoldersListResponseBody.title: Referrals Redeemable Holders List Response Body
ReferralsMembersHoldersListResponseBody.description: Response body schema for **GET** `v1/referrals/{campaignId}/members/{memberId}/holders` and for **GET** `v1/referrals/members/{memberId}/holders`

id.description: The ID of an existing customer.

source_id.description: A unique identifier of the customer who validates a voucher. It can be a customer ID or email from a CRM system, database, or a third-party service. If you also pass a customer ID (unique ID assigned by Voucherify), the source ID will be ignored.

id.description: Unique identifier of the redeemable holder.

created_at.description: Timestamp representing the date and time when the redeemable was assigned. The value is shown in the ISO 8601 format.

campaign_id.description: Unique identifier of the campaign as assigned by Voucherify.

campaign_type.description: Defines the type of the campaign.

voucher_type.description: Defines the type of the voucher.

metadata.description: A set of custom key/value pairs that you can attach to a redeemable holder. The metadata object stores all custom attributes assigned to the `redeemable_holder` object.

object.description: The type of the object represented by JSON.

FilterConditionsString.title: Filter by conditions
FilterConditionsString.description: Data filters used to narrow down the data records to be returned in the result.

$in.description: Array of resource values that should be included in the results (multiple values).

$not_in.description: Array of resource values that should be included in the results (multiple values).

$is.description: Value is exactly this value (single value).

$has_value.description: Value is NOT null. The value for this parameter is an empty string.

$is_unknown.description: Value is null. The value for this parameter is an empty string.

$starts_with.description: Value starts with the specified string.

$ends_with.description: Value ends with the specified string.

$not_contain.description: Value does NOT include the specified string.

FilterConditionsDateTime.title: Filter by conditions
FilterConditionsDateTime.description: Data filters used to narrow down the data records to be returned in the result.

$after.description: Value is after this date. The value for this parameter is shown in the ISO 8601 format.

$before.description: Value is before this date. The value for this parameter is shown in the ISO 8601 format.

$has_value.description: Value is NOT null. The value for this parameter is an empty string.

$is_unknown.description: Value is null. The value for this parameter is an empty string.

$more_than.description: Value is more days ago before the current date and time, e.g. more than `10` days ago.

$less_than.description: Value is less days before the current date and time, e.g. less than `10` days ago.

Junction.title: Junction
Junction.description: Logical Operator Between Filters. Filter by conditions set on the `junction` parameter indicating how the `conditions` should be accounted for in the query. An `AND` is an all-inclusive logical operator, meaning the `AND` operator displays a record if **ALL** the conditions separated by AND are TRUE, while  an `OR` operator displays a record if **ANY** of the conditions separated by OR is TRUE.

object.description: The type of the object represented by JSON. This object stores information about redeemables holders

data_ref.description: Identifies the name of the JSON property that contains the array of holders.

data.description: A dictionary that contains an array of holders.

total.description: Total number of holders assigned to the redeemable.

has_more.description: As query results are always limited (by the limit parameter), the `has_more` flag indicates if there are more records for given filter parameters. This lets you know if you can run another request with a `starting_after_id` query or a different limit to get more records returned in the results.

more_starting_after.description: Returns an ID that can be used to return another page of results. Use the ID in the `starting_after_id` query parameter to display another page of the results occuring after the field with that ID.

description.description: An arbitrary string that you can attach to a customer object.

phone.description: Customer's phone number. This parameter is mandatory when you try to send out codes to customers via an SMS channel.

metadata.description: A set of custom key/value pairs that you can attach to a customer. The metadata object stores all custom attributes assigned to the customer. It can be useful for storing additional information about the customer in a structured format. This metadata can be used for validating whether the customer qualifies for a discount or it can be used in building customer segments.

limit.name: limit
limit.description: Limits the number of objects to be returned. The limit can range between 1 and 100 items. If no limit is set, it returns 10 items.
